![](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/_assets/3137b1a864c689786cac76b3def62dd1/Assets/img/default-banner.jpg) # Vehicles With Flashing or Rotating Lights Certain vehicles are automatically authorized to use flashing or rotating lights or other special lights. Other vehicles require authorization by the SAAQ to use such equipment. This table scrolls horizontally | Type of light | Vehicles recognized by the _Highway Safety Code_ (the Code) or automatically authorized by the SAAQ | Vehicles requiring authorization by the SAAQ | Section of the Code | | --- | --- | --- | --- | | **Flashing or rotating red or white lights** | Police vehicles
Ambulances
Fire department vehicles | Vehicles used to transport emergency medical personnel or emergency medical equipment to the scene of an emergency
Vehicles used to maintain peace, order and public security, prevent crime, enforce the laws of Québec and Canada, or search for perpetrators
Vehicles used to dispense professional training ( [École nationale de police du Québec⁠ ⁠](https://www.enpq.qc.ca/en/))
Vehicles used by the [Ministère de l'Environnement et de la Lutte contre les changements climatiques, de la Faune et des Parcs⁠ ⁠](http://www.mddelcc.gouv.qc.ca/index_en.asp) or the [Ministère de la Sécurité publique⁠ ⁠](http://www.securitepublique.gouv.qc.ca/en.html) to travel to the scene of a fire or a disaster. | [Section 226⁠ ⁠](http://legisquebec.gouv.qc.ca/en/showdoc/cs/C-24.2#se:226) | | **Flashing or rotating blue lights** | Police vehicles | No other vehicles qualify for authorization by the SAAQ | [Section 226⁠ ⁠](http://legisquebec.gouv.qc.ca/en/showdoc/cs/C-24.2#se:226) | | **Flashing or rotating amber lights** | Vehicles equipped to refuel, repair or tow road vehicles
Equipment transport vehicles
Vehicles used for snow removal or road maintenance
Public utility vehicles belonging to a telecommunications company (or a company acting on behalf of such a company), Canada Post, a company operating an electrical transmission system or a public transit company
Farm tractors
Tool vehicles
Escort vehicles for special events | Vehicles used to intercept road vehicles under the powers conferred by a law or regulation (e.g. a vehicle owned by Revenu Québec)
Vehicles used by a security agency operating under a municipal contract
Heavy vehicles that tow a trailer or semi-trailer with a permanently fixed tank, other than the fuel tank
Municipal vehicles used exclusively to control traffic
Vehicles required to travel at a reduced speed or make repeated stops along a route as part of public utilities work
Vehicles belonging to a media corporation or an individual licenced by the Canadian Radio-Television and Telecommunications Commission (CRTC) | [Section 227⁠ ⁠](http://legisquebec.gouv.qc.ca/en/showdoc/cs/C-24.2#se:227) | | **Flashing or rotating white or purple lights** | Vehicles belonging to a funeral establishment | No other vehicles qualify for authorization by the SAAQ | [Section 227.1⁠ ⁠](http://legisquebec.gouv.qc.ca/en/showdoc/cs/C-24.2#se:227_1) | | **Rotating green light** | Emergency vehicles designed to serve as a command and coordination post | | [Section 226.1⁠ ⁠](http://legisquebec.gouv.qc.ca/en/showdoc/cs/C-24.2#se:226_1) | | Flashing green light | Vehicles used by firefighters who have the necessary authorizations from their municipal authority | | [Section 226.2⁠ ⁠](http://legisquebec.gouv.qc.ca/en/showdoc/cs/C-24.2#se:226_2) | Unless authorized by regulation, individuals may not install flashing lights on their vehicle. ## Filing an authorization and recognition application Last update: January 11, 2024 ## Safety first, on the road and online We are committed to protecting your personal information and privacy. That’s why, when we collect data, we follow a [Policy on Privacy](https://saaq.gouv.qc.ca/en/policies/privacy) that is responsible and transparent.
